TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable FileShare extends System.Enum
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed FileShare extends System.Enum

remarks.para: For an example of creating a file and writing text to a file, see [<topic://cpconwritingtexttofile>]. For an example of reading text from a file, see [<topic://cpconreadingtextfromfile>]. For an example of reading from and writing to a binary file, see [<topic://cpconReadingWritingToNewlyCreatedDataFile>].

A typical use of this enumeration is to define whether two processes can simultaneously read from the same file. For example, if a file is opened and is specified, other users can open the file for reading but not for writing.
A parameter is specified in some of the constructors for , , and in some of the Open methods of and to control how a file is opened.

summary.para: Contains constants for controlling the kind of access other objects can have to the same file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Delete = int32(4)

summary.para: Allows subsequent deleting of a file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Inheritable = int32(16)

summary.para: Makes the file handle inheritable by child processes. This is not directly supported by Win32.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare None = 0x0
.field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare None = int32(0)

summary.para: Declines sharing of the current file. Any request to open the file (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Read = 0x1
.field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Read = int32(1)

summary.para: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare ReadWrite = Read | Write
.field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare ReadWrite = int32(3)

summary.para: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading or writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading or writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Write = 0x2
.field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileShare Write = int32(2)

summary.para: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.
